section.title: Configuring a High-Fidelity Propagator
section.para: In the example below, youâ€™ll learn how to configure a high fidelity propagator for low Earth orbits. Starting from the default mission:

step.para: In the Resources tree, double-click on DefaultProp to open it.
In the Gravity section, type 21 in the Degree box.
Click on the Atmosphere Model drop-down list and select MSISE90 .
Click the Select button next to the PointMasses box.
Click on Sun and then click the right arrow -> to add the Sun to your force model.
Add Moon, and Jupiter using the same steps as above.
Click OK on the CelestialBodySelect dialog box.
Click on the UseSolarRadiationPressure check box. The box should be checked now.
Click OK on the PropSetup dialog box.
